===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かみ|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/kami<sub>2</sub>/ *[kamɨ] → /kami/ [kami]}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かみ}}. Not related to {{m|ja|上|tr=</i>{{IPAchar|/kami<sub>1</sub>/}}||up}} or {{m|ja|髪|tr=</i>{{IPAchar|/kami<sub>1</sub>/}}||hair}}. Often appears in compounds as {{IPAchar|/kamu/}} (modern {{IPAchar|/kaɴ/}}), indicating that {{IPAchar|/kami/}} is a bound or fused form deriving from *{{IPAchar|/kamu.i/}}. Note that this final ''i'' may be the {{etyl|ojp|-}} emphatic nominative particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}}, likely cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} nominative particle {{m|ko|이}}. Such fusion has occurred in other {{etyl|ja|-}} terms, such as {{m|ja|目|tr=me||eye|pos=from ''ma'' + ''i''}} or {{m|ja|酒|tr=sake||saké, liquor|pos=from ''saka'' + ''i''}}.

Compare {{cog|ain|カムイ|tr=kamuy||god}}, also present in compounds like {{m|ain|カムイモシㇼ|tr=kamuy mosir||land of the gods}}.
